Title: Alta Wind Energy Center
Description: One of the largest wind farms in the world, the Alta Wind Energy Center is located in Tehachapi, California and has a total capacity of 1,548 MW.

Title: London Array
Description: Located in the Thames Estuary in the United Kingdom, the London Array is one of the largest offshore wind farms in the world with a capacity of 630 MW.

Title: Jiuquan Wind Power Base
Description: Located in the Gansu province of China, the Jiuquan Wind Power Base is the largest wind farm in the world with a capacity of 7,965 MW.

Title: Shepherds Flat Wind Farm
Description: Located in Oregon, United States, the Shepherds Flat Wind Farm has a capacity of 845 MW and is one of the largest onshore wind farms in the world.

Title: Gansu Wind Farm
Description: Located in the Gansu province of China, the Gansu Wind Farm is one of the largest onshore wind farms in the world with a capacity of 6,000 MW.

Title: Solar Star
Description: Located in California, United States, Solar Star is one of the largest solar power plants in the world with a capacity of 579 MW.

Title: Bhadla Solar Park
Description: Located in Rajasthan, India, Bhadla Solar Park is one of the largest solar power plants in the world with a capacity of 2,245 MW.

Title: Longyangxia Dam Solar Park
Description: Located in the Qinghai province of China, the Longyangxia Dam Solar Park is one of the largest solar power plants in the world with a capacity of 850 MW.

Title: Kamuthi Solar Power Project
Description: Located in Tamil Nadu, India, the Kamuthi Solar Power Project is one of the largest solar power plants in the world with a capacity of 648 MW.

Title: Tengger Desert Solar Park
Description: Located in the Inner Mongolia region of China, the Tengger Desert Solar Park is one of the largest solar power plants in the world with a capacity of 1,547 MW.

Title: Three Gorges Dam
Description: Located in China, the Three Gorges Dam is one of the largest hydroelectric power stations in the world with a capacity of 22,500 MW.

Title: Itaipu Dam
Description: Located on the border of Brazil and Paraguay, the Itaipu Dam is one of the largest hydroelectric power stations in the world with a capacity of 14,000 MW.
